intro: Licania hookeri, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a tropical tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, rounded canopy. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Licania hookeri thrives in warm, humid climates and is native to parts of South America.
